longDef.en: to find someone or something that was lost

examples.en: The police are trying to trace the mother of a newborn baby found abandoned outside a hospital.
examples.cn: 警察试图查出那位把新生婴儿抛弃在医院外面的母亲。

examples.en: Attempts to trace the whereabouts of a man seen leaving the scene of the crime have so far been unsuccessful.
examples.cn: 有人曾看到一名男子离开犯罪现场，但迄今为止追查该男子下落的种种努力一无所获。

examples.en: Their missing daughter was finally traced to (= found in) Manchester.
examples.cn: 他们失踪的女儿最终在曼彻斯特找到了。

longDef.en: to find the origin of something

examples.en: The phone company was unable to trace the call.
examples.cn: 电话公司查不出这个电话来自何处。

examples.en: No one has yet been able to trace the source of the rumour.
examples.cn: 还没有人能够查出谣言的出处。

longDef.en: to discover the causes or origins of something by examining the way in which it has developed
longDef.cn: （根据事物的发展方式）查明…的起因（或源头），追溯

examples.en: The outbreak of food poisoning was traced to some contaminated shellfish.
examples.cn: 经调查，这次食物中毒源于一些受到污染的贝类。

examples.en: She has traced her family history back to the seventeenth century.
examples.cn: 她把家族历史追溯到了十七世纪。

examples.en: The practice of giving eggs at Easter can be traced back to (= first happened in) festivals in ancient China.
examples.cn: 复活节送彩蛋的习俗可追溯至中国古代的节庆活动。

longDef.en: to describe the way in which something has developed

examples.en: The film traces the events leading up to the Russian Revolution in 1917.
examples.cn: 该影片描述了导致1917年俄国革命爆发的一系列事件。

longDef.en: to copy a drawing or pattern, etc. by drawing over its lines through a thin piece of transparent paper
longDef.cn: （把透明纸覆盖在底样上）描摹

examples.en: Did you draw this picture yourself, or did you trace it?
examples.cn: 这幅画是你自己画的，还是你描摹的？

examples.en: She learned to write her name by tracing out the letters.
examples.cn: 她通过描摹字母学会了写自己的名字。

longDef.en: to draw a shape by showing the main or outer lines

examples.en: The child was tracing patterns in/on the sand with a stick.
examples.cn: 孩子用棍子在沙子上勾画出一个个图案。

longDef.en: a sign that something has happened or existed

examples.en: He attempted to cover up all the traces of his crime.
examples.cn: 他试图掩盖他犯罪的蛛丝马迹。

examples.en: When she moved out, she left no trace of having been there.
examples.cn: 她搬走后，没有留下任何在那儿住过的痕迹。

examples.en: My wallet has been missing for several days and I can't find any trace of it.
examples.cn: 我的钱包不见好几天了，而我就是找不到它。

examples.en: He seems to have vanished without (a) trace (= no one knows where he is).
examples.cn: 他似乎已经消失得无影无踪了。

longDef.en: an act of finding information about something electronically, or the record of the information found in this way
longDef.cn: （利用电子仪器的）追踪，描记图

examples.en: The phone company put a trace on the call.
examples.cn: 电话公司用电子仪器追踪了这次通话。

examples.en: Traces of drugs were found in his blood.
examples.cn: 在他的血液中发现了少许毒品。

examples.en: There is just a trace of grey in his hair.
examples.cn: 他头发中夹杂着少许白发。

examples.en: She speaks English without any trace of an accent.
examples.cn: 她讲英语丝毫不带口音。

examples.en: There was the faintest trace of a smile on her lips.
examples.cn: 她的唇边带着一丝微笑。

examples.en: "How wonderful!" she said, without any trace of sarcasm.
examples.cn: “多好啊！”她说道，语气中丝毫没有挖苦的意思。
